ANNOUNCEMENT
Definition The internal and external audio and visual announcements that can be utilized on a route. Announcements can be defined at several levels.

The hierarchy for which internal announcement is actually invoked is:
Pattern_Geo_Node_Xref (Override)
Geo_Node (Base)

The hierarchy for which external announcement is actually invoked is:
Pattern_Geo_Interval_Xref (Override)
Pattern (Base)
Note

BLOCK
Definition Each entry defines the work of a vehicle from the time it leaves the vehicle base until its next return.

This is what a bus does all day; the total path it traverses from
garage pull out to pull in. It may include \"deadhead\" sections to get
to/from garage and start of a route trip or between trips on different
routes. But basically it is a collection of trips. The term comes from
\"blocking\" which is the process of grouping/assigning route trips from the
public schedule into chunks that can be performed sequentially by a
vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE BLOCK(
     BLOCK_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     PULL_OUT_LOC_ID           numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     PULL_IN_LOC_ID            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     BLOCK_ABBR                varchar(9)         NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_NUM                 numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     PULL_OUT_TIME             numeric(10, 0)     NULL
                              CHECK (PULL_OUT_TIME BETWEEN 0 AND 4294967295),
     PULL_IN_TIME              numeric(10, 0)     NULL
                              CHECK (PULL_IN_TIME BETWEEN 0 AND 4294967295),
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     VEHICLE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     PADDLE_NOTES              varchar(2000)      NULL,
     MDT_BLOCK_ID              int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBLOCK PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (BLOCK_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_TYPE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BASE_BLOCK1 FOREIGN KEY (PULL_OUT_LOC_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_BASE(VEHICLE_BASE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BASE_BLOCK2 FOREIGN KEY (PULL_IN_LOC_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_BASE(VEHICLE_BASE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_TYPE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_TYPE(VEHICLE_TYPE_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PULL_OUT_LOC_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PULL_IN_LOC_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
BLOCK_ABBR varchar(9) NO An alpha-numeric identifier used to associate a sequence of trips to a transit vehicle.
BLOCK_NUM numeric(5, 0) YES
PULL_OUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time at which a vehicle pulls out of its storage facility (vehicle base) in order to arrive at the first timepoint of its scheduled revenue service.

This is a denormalized, calculated attribute.
PULL_IN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time at which a transit vehicle arrives at its storage facility (vehicle base) after deadheading from the last time point of its scheduled revenue service.

This is a denormalized, calculated attribute.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
VEHICLE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Specifies a particular type of vehicle that is required to run this route. For example, must have a wheelchair lift, certain length, articulated, etc.
PADDLE_NOTES varchar(2000) YES
MDT_BLOCK_ID int YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKBLOCK PrimaryKey BLOCK_ID
idxBLOCK_VEHICLE_TYPE_ID Index VEHICLE_TYPE_ID
idxBLOCK_TRANSIT_DIV_ID Index TRANSIT_DIV_ID
idxBLOCK_VEHICLE_ID Index VEHICLE_ID
idxBLOCK_TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID Index TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
idxBLOCK_SERVICE_TYPE_ID Index SERVICE_TYPE_ID
idxBLOCK_PULL_OUT_LOC_ID Index PULL_OUT_LOC_ID
idxBLOCK_PULL_IN_LOC_ID Index PULL_IN_LOC_ID

Foreign Keys

DEADHEADS
Definition This table keeps track of deadheads, which are intervals that a vehice travels in the course of performing a block, but which are not explicitly part of any route or pattern. This would include Pullout and Pullins, when a bus is going from or to a garage, and deadheads betweeen patterns, in which the bus in not really on either route.

The field DH_TYPE defines what type this is:
1) A deadhead between patterns
2) A pullout
3) A pullin

Each deadhead will also have a block, trip, route, pattern associated with it.

In the case of types 1 and 2, this will be the block, trip, route, pattern of the pattern to which the deadhead leads into.In the case of type 3, it will be the block, trip, route, pattern of the last pattern it last performed.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DEADHEADS(
     DEADHEADS_ID                 int                IDENTITY(1,1),
     Time_Table_Version_ID        numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TRIP_ID                      numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     Pattern_ID                   numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     Geo_Node_Interval_ID         numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     External_Announcement_ID     numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     Block_ID                     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     DH_TYPE                      numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     MDT_ANNUN                    numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     MDT_LEN                      numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     MDT_COMDIR                   numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     IsRevenue                    bit                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT PKDEADHEADS_ID PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (DEADHEADS_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
DEADHEADS_ID int NO
Time_Table_Version_ID numeric(5, 0) YES
TRIP_ID numeric(18, 0) YES

DUAL_RNET
Definition For vehicles with 2 VLU units (Rail), this table is used to store the primary and secondary RNET addresses. For example, if the primary RNET = 1 and there is a secondary unit with RNET = 2 there will be 1 entry in this table:
Row 1: RNET_PRIMARY = 1, RNET_SECONDARY = 2

EVENT_POINT
Definition A mobile point event. Contains all information to drive the event. The Mobile Event File is generated based upon data in this table.

Each row can be separated into four sections: Identification data items, Criteria data items, Action data items, and Associated child event items.
Note

GEO_NODE
Definition Each entry defines a point at which time is measured to create trips.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE(
     GEO_NODE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID              numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ABBR                varchar(8)         NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_NAME                varchar(75)        NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     LATITUDE                     numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE                    numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     ALTITUDE                     numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     DETOUR_IND                   varchar(1)         NULL
                                 CHECK (DETOUR_IND IN ('Y','N')),
     DETOUR_LATITUDE              numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     DETOUR_LONGITIUDE            numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     REMARK                       varchar(2000)      NULL,
     DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY        numeric(1, 0)      NULL
                                 CHECK (DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY IN ('0','1','2')),
     NUM_OF_SATELLITES            numeric(2, 0)      NULL,
     ACTIVATION_DATE              datetime           NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE            datetime           NULL,
     MAP_LATITUDE                 numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     MAP_LONGITUDE                numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID         numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     NUM_SURVEY_POINTS            numeric(2, 0)      NULL,
     USE_SURVEY                   bit                NOT NULL,
     MDT_LATITUDE                 numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     MDT_LONGITUDE                numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LOCK_MAP                     bit                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKADH_ZONE_GEO_NODE1 FOREIGN KEY (ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_ZONE(ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKADH_ZONE_GEO_NODE2 FOREIGN KEY (DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_ZONE(ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_ZONE_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_ZONE(ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GEO_NODE_ABBR varchar(8) NO An alpha-numeric identifier of a location at which time is measured.
GEO_NODE_NAME varchar(75) NO The common, or public name for a geographic location on a route.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Location identification.
LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Location identification.
ALTITUDE numeric(7, 0) YES Location identification.
DETOUR_IND varchar(1) YES Indicates if this node should be included in a detour pattern. For example, this node may be temporarily inaccessible due to road construction.
DETOUR_LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The temporary latitude for a node that is moved due to a detour.
DETOUR_LONGITIUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The temporary longitude for a node that is moved due to a detour.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES Free-form text area to store a comment regarding a node.
DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY numeric(1, 0) YES Value of 0, 1, or 2.
NUM_OF_SATELLITES numeric(2, 0) YES Number of satellites used to survey this point.
ACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a node is activated.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a node is deactivated (logical delete). The row can be physically deleted only if it is not referenced by other related tables.
MAP_LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The latitude of this node on the map in Route Generator.
MAP_LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The longitude of this node on the map in Route Generator.
ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
NUM_SURVEY_POINTS numeric(2, 0) YES The number of DGPS positions collected for point surveying, usually a number between 1 and 20.
USE_SURVEY bit NO Indicates if latitude and longitude is from a survey (1) or from a map (0).
MDT_LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Latitude stored in the corresponding MDT file. Primarily used by TMRouteManager to build MDT files.
MDT_LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Longitude stored in the corresponding MDT file. Primarily used by TMRouteManager to build MDT files.
LOCK_MAP bit NO

GEO_NODE_INTERVAL
Definition Each entry defines a segment between two time points.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL(
     INTERVAL_ID                   numeric(5, 0)      IDENTITY(1,1),
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID      numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     INTERVAL_DESIGNATOR           varchar(20)        NULL,
     START_POINT_ID                numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     END_POINT_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID                numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MAP          numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MEASURED     numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     COMPASS_DIRECTION             numeric(3, 0)      NULL
                                  CHECK (COMPASS_DIRECTION BETWEEN -1 AND 359),
     USE_MAP                       bit                NOT NULL,
     MDT_DIST                      numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     LOCK_MAP                      bit                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_INTERVAL PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (INTERVAL_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_GN_INTRVL FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_INTERV1 FOREIGN KEY (END_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_INTERV2 FOREIGN KEY (START_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_GN_INTRVL FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INTERVAL_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Identifies a unique path between two time points.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INTERVAL_DESIGNATOR varchar(20) YES An alpha-numeric identifier of the interval (link) between two time points.
START_POINT_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
END_POINT_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MAP numeric(9, 0) YES The distance between the two points, as determined using a map.
DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MEASURED numeric(9, 0) YES The distance between the two points, as determined using measurement equipment.
COMPASS_DIRECTION numeric(3, 0) YES The compass direction the bus is traveling through the segment.
USE_MAP bit NO
MDT_DIST numeric(9, 0) YES
LOCK_MAP bit NO

     LIST_DATA           varchar(100)      NULL,
     LIST_TEXT           varchar(100)      NULL,
     READ_ONLY_FLAGS     int               NULL,
     REQUIRED_FLAGS      int               NULL,
     VALIDATION_RULE     varchar(2000)     NULL,
     VALIDATION_TEXT     varchar(200)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT PK_INCIDENT_FIELD_DESCRIPTOR PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (SOURCE_TABLE, SOURCE_COLUMN)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
SOURCE_TABLE varchar(50) NO
SOURCE_COLUMN varchar(50) NO
DISPLAY_COLUMN varchar(100) YES
MULTIPLE_CHOICE bit YES
LIST_DATA varchar(100) YES
LIST_TEXT varchar(100) YES
READ_ONLY_FLAGS int YES Determines if the field is ReadOnly on the form.
REQUIRED_FLAGS int YES Determines if the field is Required to be entered on the form.
VALIDATION_RULE varchar(2000) YES A rule to evaluate. If evaluates to True, then the field is valid. If not, then the VALIDATION_TEXT is displayed and the user is prompted to edit the field.
VALIDATION_TEXT varchar(200) YES Usually an error message to display to the user because the VALIDATION_RULE caught invalid data.

MAINT_MILESTONE
Definition This table details maintenance milestones that can be scheduled for vehicles.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MAINT_MILESTONE(
     MAINT_MILESTONE_ID     numeric(5, 0)      IDENTITY(1,1),
     MILESTONE_TEXT         varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     MILESTONE_TYPE         numeric(3, 0)      NOT NULL,
     MILEAGE                numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     TIME_INTERVAL          numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE      datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMAINT_MILESTONE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MAINT_MILESTONE_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MAINT_MILESTONE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
MILESTONE_TEXT varchar(100) NO The text description of the milestone.
MILESTONE_TYPE numeric(3, 0) NO A composite value defining the type of milestone.

0x00 Absolute Mileage
0x01 Mileage Interval
0x02 Time Interval Days
0x03 Mileage/Time Interval Days
0x04 Time Interval Months
0x05 Mileage/Time Interval Months
0x08 Time Interval Years
0x09 Mileage/Time Interval Years
MILEAGE numeric(10, 0) YES The number of miles defined for Absolute Mileage, Mileage Interval, and Combination Mileage/Time Interval milestones.
TIME_INTERVAL numeric(3, 0) YES The number of days, months, or years defined for Time Interval and Combination Mileage/Time Interval milestones.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date and time that this row was deactivated. If it is Null, the table entry is considered to be active.

     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),

     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_DIR_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTIME_POINT_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (TIME_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_POINT(TIME_POINT_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA

MDT_FORMAT
Definition Used to allow properties to configure the mobile logon screens and to interpret the logins into a block name.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MDT_FORMAT(
     ENTRY_FIELD     smallint        NOT NULL,
     DELIMITER       varchar(1)      NULL,
     FIELD_SIZE      int             NULL,
     FILL_CHAR       varchar(1)      NULL,
     LABEL           varchar(10)     NULL,
     ENABLED         smallint        NULL
                    CHECK (ENABLED=0 or ENABLED=1),
     ALPHA           smallint        NULL
                    CHECK (ALPHA=0 or ALPHA=1),
     LEFTFILL        smallint        NULL
                    CHECK (LEFTFILL=0 or LEFTFILL=1),
     CONSTRAINT PKMDT_FORMAT PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ENTRY_FIELD)
)
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ENTRY_FIELD smallint NO A 1-based number of which field on the mobile this record represents, currently up to 3 digits.
DELIMITER varchar(1) YES Optional character that describes any character between this field and the previous in the block name
FIELD_SIZE int YES Size of this entry field in characters.
FILL_CHAR varchar(1) YES This is an optional fill character, for example a 0, to fill to the size of the field (FIELD_SIZE).
LABEL varchar(10) YES The label the mobile will display for this field.
ENABLED smallint YES This determines whether or not this field is enabled on the mobile ( 0 = disabled, 1= enabled)
ALPHA smallint YES 0 if numeric only, otherwise 1.
LEFTFILL smallint YES 0 if the fill character is put on the right, other wise 1 if left

OPERATING_TIME_TYPE
Definition Each entry is a text description for the enumerated types for use in displays.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE OPERATING_TIME_TYPE(
     OPERATING_TIME_ID       numeric(3, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     OPERATING_TIME_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKOPERATING_TIME_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (OPERATING_TIME_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
OPERATING_TIME_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
OPERATING_TIME_TEXT varchar(100) NO A numeric value indicating the type of operating time.

1 Deadhead Time- Bus travel time in non-revenue bus travel time to or from the garage and a terminus point where revenue services begins or ends; or within a vehicle assignment from the end of one revenue service segment to the beginning of another.
2 Dwell Time - Time scheduled for loading pas- sengers or waiting for them to transfer at a stop point.
3 Layover Time - Scheduled rest and recovery, usually at a terminal.
4 Make Up Time - Payment for time in order that the total paid time for an operator assignment is equal to a minimum daily or weekly guarantee.
5 Overtime - Identifies the amount of scheduled time paid beyond the daily guarantee or actually operated beyond the scheduled time.
6 PullIn Time - Deadhead running time allowed a transit vehicle to arrive at the VehicleBase after the final access or time point in the vehicle assignment.
7 PullOut Time - Deadhead running time allowed a transit vehicle to depart the VehicleBase prior to arriving at the first time point in the vehicle assignment.
8 Spread Time - Total elapsed time between the first report time and the final turn-in time of an operator's assignment.
9 Travel Time - A period of time allocated to an operator during which (s)he must travel from one piece of work to another.
10 TurnInAllowance - Paid time for the operator to report to the dispatcher at the conclusion of a run.
11 Report Time - Paid time for the operator to prepare for the start of a run or a piece of work.
12 Platform Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to drive the transit vehicle, including layover time.
13 Break Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to have a rest.
14 Meal Break Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to have a rest (for a meal).

Primary and Unique Keys

PATTERN
Definition A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.

Or, a series/sequence of timepoints (path) from a route start to a
route end.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PATTERN(
     PATTERN_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID           numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     PATTERN_ABBR                 varchar(10)        NOT NULL,
     PATTERN_NAME                 varchar(30)        NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID        numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     DETOUR_IND                   varchar(1)         NULL,
     DETOUR_DISTANCE_CHG          numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND          varchar(1)         NULL
                                 CHECK (NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND IN ('Y','N')),
     SRC_PATTERN_ID               numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPATTERN PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (PATTERN_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECTION_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PATTERN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_ABBR varchar(10) NO An alpha-numeric identifier for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a route.
PATTERN_NAME varchar(30) YES The name for a defined sequence of points and events along a variation of a route that represents a physical path traversed by a transit vehicle in a network.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DETOUR_IND varchar(1) YES Identifies this pattern as a detour pattern.
DETOUR_DISTANCE_CHG numeric(7, 2) YES The net distance change resulting from this detour as compared to the normal route.
NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND varchar(1) YES An indicator to specify that the next stop should be announced.
SRC_PATTERN_ID numeric(9, 0) YES Used by TMRouteManager merge process.

ROUTE
Definition Each entry defines a collection of patterns in revenue service.

This is a collection of patterns, and is the way the patterns are organized for presentation to the public on printed schedules.

It is not always a simple loop or out-and-back. It may have
different paths going out vs coming back, different paths per time of day,
and different end points (like a tree branch fork). Each of these unique
paths between a start and end point on a route is a pattern so a route is a
collection of patterns.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE(
     ROUTE_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      IDENTITY(1,1),
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID            numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ABBR                varchar(8)         NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_NAME                varchar(75)        NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ADHERENCE_EARLY_SEC       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ADHERENCE_LATE_SEC        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     IsRevenue                 bit                DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_GROUP_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_GROUP(ROUTE_GROUP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_GROUP_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Route group, or interline that route is associated with.
ROUTE_ABBR varchar(8) NO An alpha-numeric identifier of a collection of patterns in a revenue service. The publicized route identifer; for example 72.
ROUTE_NAME varchar(75) NO Names a collection of patterns in a revenue service.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Transit division associated with the route.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Schedule version.
ADHERENCE_EARLY_SEC numeric(10, 0) YES Route override for schedule adherence.
ADHERENCE_LATE_SEC numeric(10, 0) YES Route override for schedule adherence.
IsRevenue bit NO

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE PrimaryKey ROUTE_ID
idxROUTE_TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID Index TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
idxROUTE_ROUTE_GROUP_ID Index ROUTE_GROUP_ID
idxROUTE_TRANSIT_DIV_ID Index TRANSIT_DIV_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF
Definition Controls the order the time points are traveled for a specific route within a base route/interline/route group.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF(
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID               numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID           numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ORDER             varchar(1)        NULL
                                 CHECK (TIME_POINT_ORDER IN ('F','R')),
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_GROUP_ID, ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID, ROUTE_ID, ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECT_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X1 FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECT_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X2 FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_GRP_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_GROUP(ROUTE_GROUP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

RUN
Definition Each entry defines the daily pieces of work assigned to a transit employee. This is what the driver does during their shift. This may exactly
match a block, be part of a block (say 2 operators share 10 hour shifts on
a block that lasts 20 hours), or several blocks (4 hours on one block and 4
on another).

Also known as \"Operator Run\", \"Operator Paddle\", or \"Block Paddle\".
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RUN(
     RUN_ID                    numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     RUN_DESIGNATOR            varchar(9)         NOT NULL,
     RUN_TYPE_ID               numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     RUN_NUM                   numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     MDT_RUN_ID                int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRUN PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (RUN_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_TYPE_RUN FOREIGN KEY (RUN_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN_TYPE(RUN_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_TYPE_RUN FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_RUN FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_RUN FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Identifies the piece of work for an operator on a given day type or within a particular schedule.
RUN_DESIGNATOR varchar(9) NO The alpha-numeric designator of the run.
RUN_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
RUN_NUM numeric(10, 0) YES The Trapeze run number.
MDT_RUN_ID int YES

Primary and Unique Keys

SCHEDULED_WAIVER
Definition Holds scheduled adherence waivers for specific timepoints during a daily timespan that is effective over a period of multiple days. The waiver may apply to all crossings (within that timespan), or only to crossings for a particular route and direction.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SCHEDULED_WAIVER(
     Waiver_ID               numeric(5, 0)      IDENTITY(1,1),
     Waiver_Description      varchar(50)        NULL,
     Route                   numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL
                            CHECK (ROUTE BETWEEN 0 AND 65535),
     Direction               numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     Start_Time              numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     End_Time                numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     Activation_Date         datetime           NULL,
     Missed_Allowed_Flag     numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     Deactivation_Date       datetime           NOT NULL,
     Early_Allowed_Flag      numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     Late_Allowed_Flag       numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT PK432 PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (Waiver_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
Waiver_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Unique system assigned identity.
Waiver_Description varchar(50) YES Title or note for the waiver
Route numeric(5, 0) YES Route in which waiver is effective or NULL if applicable to all crossings
Direction numeric(18, 0) YES Direction in which waiver is effective or NULL if applicable to all crossings
Start_Time numeric(18, 0) YES Daily begin time after which the waiver becomes effective
End_Time numeric(18, 0) YES Daily end time for waiver
Activation_Date datetime YES Start of effective date period
Missed_Allowed_Flag numeric(1, 0) YES Set to 1 if timepoint crossing may be missed, else 0
Deactivation_Date datetime NO End of effective date period (inclusive)
Early_Allowed_Flag numeric(1, 0) YES Set to 1 if early arrival is permitted, else 0
Late_Allowed_Flag numeric(1, 0) YES Set to 1 if late arrival is permitted, else 0

Key Name Key Type Keys

TRIP
Definition A one way movement of a transit vehicle in revenue service between two points. It can also be defined as a scheduled (timed) pattern.

Or, the scheduled traversal of a bus over a pattern.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TRIP(
     TRIP_ID                      numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     WORK_PIECE_ID                numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     TRIP_TYPE_ID                 numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID        numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     BLOCK_ID                     numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRIP_SERIAL_NUMBER           numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     TRIP_SEQUENCE                numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     REMARK                       varchar(2000)      NULL,
     BLOCK_TRIP_SEQ               numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     Pattern_ID                   numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     TRIP_START_NODE_ID           numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     TRIP_END_TIME                numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     TRIP_END_NODE_ID             numeric(9, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTRIP PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TRIP_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRIP_TYPE_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP_TYPE(TRIP_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES External announcement for this trip.
WORK_PIECE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES
TRIP_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Trip category.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Schedule version.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Transit division associated with this trip.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_SERIAL_NUMBER numeric(18, 0) YES Property-assigned identification for a trip for Section 15 reporting sample.
TRIP_SEQUENCE numeric(7, 0) YES A number to order the trips within a block.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information regarding a trip.
BLOCK_TRIP_SEQ numeric(7, 0) YES Trip Sequence Number within a Block (which equals Trip Start Time)
Pattern_ID numeric(18, 0) YES
TRIP_START_NODE_ID numeric(9, 0) YES
TRIP_END_TIME numeric(9, 0) YES
TRIP_END_NODE_ID numeric(9, 0) YES

EEPROM_TEMPLATE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES References EEPROM_TEMPLATE table.
DECOMMISSION bit NO If 1, the vehicle has been decommissioned.

Definition A log of maintenance events that have occurred for every vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE VEHICLE_MAINT_LOG(
     VEHICLE_MAINT_LOG_ID       numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     VEHICLE_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     SCHEDULED_MILESTONE_ID     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     START_DATE                 datetime           NULL,
     COMPLETION_DATE            datetime           NULL,
     MILEAGE                    numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     MAINT_PERSONNEL            varchar(100)       NULL,
     NOTES                      varchar(2000)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKVEHICLE_MAINT_LOG PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (VEHICLE_MAINT_LOG_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKSCHED_MILEST_VEH_MAINT_LOG FOREIGN KEY (SCHEDULED_MILESTONE_ID)
     REFERENCES SCHEDULED_MILESTONE(SCHEDULED_MILESTONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_VEH_MAINT_LOG FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
VEHICLE_MAINT_LOG_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The vehicle associated with this log entry.
SCHEDULED_MILESTONE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES The scheduled task associated with this log entry.
START_DATE datetime YES The date and time when maintenance for this vehicle commenced.
COMPLETION_DATE datetime YES The date and time when maintenance for this vehicle was completed.
MILEAGE numeric(10, 0) YES The actual mileage taken from the odometer of the vehicle being serviced.
MAINT_PERSONNEL varchar(100) YES The name of the person responsible for the maintenance event.
NOTES varchar(2000) YES A free-form text area to store comments or details about this maintenance event.

WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION
Definition The work assignment configuration of dispatcher roles. One or more roles are assigned to each dispatcher by the dispatcher supervisor.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION(
     CONFIGURATION_ID               numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     CONFIGURATION_NAME             varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     FILE_VERSION                   varchar(8)         NULL,
     ROLES_VERSION                  varchar(8)         NULL,
     DEFAULT_ASSIGN_VERSION         varchar(8)         NULL,
     FORCE_ASSIGNMENT_IND           varchar(1)         NULL
                                   CHECK (FORCE_ASSIGNMENT_IND IN ('Y','N')),
     DISPATCH_ASSIGNMENT_METHOD     varchar(1)         NULL
                                   CHECK (DISPATCH_ASSIGNMENT_METHOD IN ('R','E')),
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID          numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKWORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (CONFIGURATION_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_WA_CONFIGUR FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CONFIGURATION_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
CONFIGURATION_NAME varchar(100) NO The text identification for a version of the configuration.
FILE_VERSION varchar(8) YES The operating system file version that was used to load this configuration into the database.
ROLES_VERSION varchar(8) YES The version identification for the role definition.
DEFAULT_ASSIGN_VERSION varchar(8) YES The default assignments version.
FORCE_ASSIGNMENT_IND varchar(1) YES Y indicates that a vehicle should be assigned, or "pushed" to a dispatcher when no dispatchers for that fleet are logged on.
DISPATCH_ASSIGNMENT_METHOD varchar(1) YES The method in which an unassigned vehicle is assigned to a dispatcher for a fleet. Round-robin or Explicit.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKWORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION PrimaryKey CONFIGURATION_ID
idxWORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION_TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID Index TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TIME_TABLE_VERSION WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION WORK_ASSIGNMENT_ROLE Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID

FILEGROUP TMMAIN_DATA

     ROLE_VERSION         varchar(8)         NULL,
     ROLE_NAME            varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKWORK_ASSIGNMENT_ROLE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (CONFIGURATION_ID, ROLE_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKWA_CONFIG_WA_ROLE FOREIGN KEY (CONFIGURATION_ID)
     REFERENCES WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION(CONFIGURATION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go

Attachments
Name Datatype Value Override Default Value Description

WORK_PIECE
Definition Each entry defines a piece of work scheduled for an operator. Operator work assignments reflect labor agreements and transit policy considerations. These considerations include platform and layover time and locations, operator paid work time, reporting times, and relief locations and policies. (ST-ITS-TCIP-SCH)
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE WORK_PIECE(
     WORK_PIECE_ID             numeric(10, 0)     IDENTITY(1,1),
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     RUN_ID                    numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     OPERATING_TIME_ID         numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     PAY_ID                    numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     BEGIN_TIME                numeric(10, 0)     NULL
                              CHECK (BEGIN_TIME BETWEEN 0 AND 4294967295),
     END_TIME                  numeric(10, 0)     NULL
                              CHECK (END_TIME BETWEEN 0 AND 4294967295),
     BLOCK_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKWORK_PIECE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (WORK_PIECE_ID)
     ON TMMAIN_INDEX,
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_WORK_PIECE FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKOPER_TIME_TYPE_WRK_PIECE FOREIGN KEY (OPERATING_TIME_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATING_TIME_TYPE(OPERATING_TIME_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKPAY_TYPE_WORK_PIECE FOREIGN KEY (PAY_ID)
     REFERENCES PAY_TYPE(PAY_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_WORK_PIECE FOREIGN KEY (RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN(RUN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_WORK_PIECE FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON TMMAIN_DATA
go
